ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A great and in-depth summary of history and literature in China.

Yes I would absolutely recommend it to fellow history students, even people who don't exclusively study Chinese history.It is a course that truly deepens and broadens one's knowledge and understanding of modern China.

It's a profound study of the Chinese modern history.I would definitely recommend this course to another student who has already learned the basic outlines of the Republic of China's history.Because it's not a class for beginners. If you know nothing about Chinese modern history and come to the class, you will feel confused and cannot catch up with the discussion.
I would recommend it to other students. It is a great class to anyone who is interested in Chinese history or Chinese literature.

As a non-historian, I found the course quite challenging, but it cued me in to essential perspectives and sources I hadn't been familiar with previously. Class discussion wasn't always as productive as I'd hoped - but overall a very helpful course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Expanded my knowledge of China beyond just economics and politics.

To start with, this course helped me gain knowledge in a variety of subjects that I wasn't previously familiar with.But more than anything, this course gave me many new ideas that I hope to explore in depth in my future research!
As a student majoring in literature before, I lack the training in history discipline. Taking this course help me develop a sense of history and look into problems from different perspectives.
This class gave me a lot of inspirations. It taught me how closely history and literature are related, and how to use them together.
This course allowed me to become more familiar with historical perspectives that form an essential background for my contemporary research.
